Participant&#146;s employment for Cause, or the date the Participant&#146;s Employer ceases to be a member of the controlled group of corporations which includes the Company; provided that after a Change in Control the Participant&#146;s membership
shall continue until death or until the termination of employment for Cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE III </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Plan Benefit </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.1 <U>Amount of Plan
Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The amount of a Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit shall be equal to (i)&nbsp;plus (ii)&nbsp;plus (iii), except that a Participant who is only a Grandfathered Participant shall be
entitled only to the Plan Benefit specified in (iv), as follows: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.33% x the Participant&#146;s Compensation for each Year of Service after December&nbsp;31, 1993 and before January&nbsp;1, 2008, including (subject to (v), below) Target ICP for
those years that Target ICP exceeded 1/3 of base Compensation, and which is in excess of the amount payable under Section&nbsp;3.1(b)(2) of the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan and under the provisions of the Excess Plan and the SERP which provide
for the related excess and supplemental benefits; plus </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.33% x the number of projected Years of Service to age 65 (not to exceed 5) x the Participant&#146;s final year of Compensation, including (subject to (v), below) Target ICP; plus
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.67% x Years of Service credited under the American Cyanamid Company Employees&#146; Retirement Plan as of December&nbsp;31, 1993 x final average compensation,
including (subject to (v), below) Target ICP, where final average compensation equals the Participant&#146;s average annual Compensation including (subject to (v), below) Target ICP based on the three calendar years </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-7- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="13%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">out of the last ten calendar years prior to January&nbsp;1, 2004 which yields the highest average; minus the sum of the Participant&#146;s accrued benefits
under the Past Service Plan and under the &#147;roll-up&#148; formula of Section&nbsp;3.1(b)(1) of the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan (including any portion of such &#147;roll-up&#148; benefit which is payable under the Excess Plan and/or the
SERP), before Social Security offset; or </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the case of a Participant who is only a Grandfathered Participant, the Grandfathered Participant&#146;s accrued benefit, if any, as reflected on the Grandfathered Participant
Schedule. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(v)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In the case of a Participant whose employment terminates on or after January&nbsp;1, 1999, if for any year (commencing with the year which is five years prior to the later of the
year in which the Participant (x)&nbsp;first becomes a Participant, including a Grandfathered Participant, or (y)&nbsp;attains [or, but for death would have attained] age 55) Target ICP is less than 1/3 of base Compensation, the ICP-based component
of the Plan Benefit for such year under paragraph A, B and C above, shall be computed using the higher of (x)&nbsp;Target ICP or (y)&nbsp;actual ICP up to 1/3 of base Compensation. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">There is no reduction under subsections (a)(1), (a)(ii), (a)(iii) or (a)(iv) above for early commencement for benefits commencing on or after a Participant&#146;s attainment of age
60 or commencing at any earlier date if a Participant&#146;s employment is terminated within two years after a Change in Control <U>provided</U> that such Participant&#146;s employment is terminated either (i)&nbsp;by an Employer or (ii)&nbsp;by the
Participant for Good Reason. The amounts payable pursuant Section&nbsp;3.1(a)(1), (a)(ii), (a)(iii) or (a)(iv) are subject to reduction for commencement prior to age 60 in accordance with the terms of the Retirement Plan, except as provided in the
prior sentence in the case of a Change in Control. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of preventing a reduction for early commencement of benefits when and as provided above, there shall be added to the amounts payable to a Participant (other than a
Grandfathered Participant) under Sections 3.1(a)(1), (a)(ii), (a)(iii) above, or to the amounts payable to a Grandfathered Participant under Section&nbsp;3.1(a)(iv), above, respectively, the amount of any reduction for early commencement in such
Participant&#146;s benefits under the related provisions of the Past Service Plan, the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan, the Excess Plan and the SERP, as the case may be, which occurs at an age where such a reduction does not occur under this
Section&nbsp;3.1 of the Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">For purposes of Section&nbsp;3.1(a)(ii) above, a Participant shall have five projected Years of Service (except that service shall not be projected beyond age 65).
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-8- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.2 <U>Total and Permanent Disability Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">An Officer who is an Eligible Employee and who incurs a Separation from Service as a result of Total and Permanent Disability shall automatically become a
Participant hereunder. A Participant who incurs a Separation from Employment as a result of Total and Permanent Disability shall be entitled to a Plan Benefit computed in accordance with Sections 3.1(a)(i), (a)(ii) and (a)(iii) of the Plan, if
applicable, reduced by the amount of any loss-of-time payments to which the Participant might be entitled under workers&#146; compensation laws, and excluding any portion of a Plan Benefit based on projected Years of Service unless approved by the
Committee or after a Change in Control. Plan Benefits hereunder shall not be reduced on account of early commencement. The Plan Benefit under this Section&nbsp;3.2 of the Plan shall be paid in the form elected by Participant in accordance with
Article VI of the Plan. A Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit pursuant to this Section&nbsp;3.2 of the Plan shall be paid beginning six months after the Participant Separates from Service, provided that in no event will payment be made later than the
fifteenth day of the third calendar month following the date on which the Participant has been Separated from Service for six months. On the first business day of the seventh month following the Participant&#146;s termination from employment, the
Participant shall receive a lump sum payment equal to the payments that would have been paid during the six-month suspension period described in the preceding sentence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE IV </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Vesting </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit shall be fully vested at all times; provided, however, that Plan Benefits hereunder are subject to divestment and shall
be forfeited if the Participant&#146;s employment with an Employer is terminated for Cause. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE V </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Death Benefits </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.1 <U>Standard Death
Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:3px;line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If a Participant dies prior to incurring a Separation from Service, the
Participant&#146;s surviving spouse or the Participant&#146;s other designated beneficiary, shall receive a benefit calculated pursuant to Section&nbsp;3.1 of the Plan adjusted as if the Participant had elected a Modified Spouse Option with 50%
survivor benefit, as if such Participant had retired on the date of the Participant&#146;s death (irrespective of whether such Participant was eligible to retire on such date) and had survived to the first business day of the month immediately
following the Participant&#146;s 60</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> birthday (if such date is subsequent to the actual date of death). If the Participant is at least age 55 on
the date of death, payment under this Section&nbsp;5.1 of the Plan shall commence on the first business day of the month following the Participant&#146;s death, but in no event later than the fifteenth day of the third calendar month following the
date on which the Participant dies. If the Participant is not at least age 55 on the date of death, </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-9- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">payment shall commence on the first business day of the month following the date that the Participant would have attained age 55 if the Participant had
lived, but in no event later than the fifteenth day of the third calendar month following the date on which the Participant would have attained age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">5.2 <U>Special Death Benefit</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%;padding-bottom:3px;line-height:95%; vertical-align:top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an Officer who
is an Eligible Employee dies, and if, on the date of the death of such Employee, (i)&nbsp;the sum of the Eligible Employee&#146;s age and Years of Service under the Employees&#146; Retirement Plan equal 65, and (ii)&nbsp;such spouse survives such
Eligible Employee, there shall be payable to such surviving spouse a benefit calculated in accordance with Section&nbsp;3.1 of the Plan as if the Eligible Employee had elected a Modified Spouse Option with 50% survivor benefit, had retired on the
date of death (irrespective of whether such Eligible Employee was eligible to retire on such date) and had survived to the first business day of the month immediately following the Eligible Employee&#146;s 60</FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="1"><SUP>th</SUP></FONT><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"> birthday (if such date is subsequent to actual date of death). ). If the Participant is at least age 55 on the date of death, payment under this Section&nbsp;5.2 of the Plan shall
commence on the first business day of the month following the Participant&#146;s death, but in no event later the fifteenth day of the third calendar month following the date on which the Participant dies. If the Participant is not at least age 55
on the date of death, payment shall commence on the first business day of the month following the date that the Participant would have attained age 55 is the Participant had lived, but in no event later the fifteenth day of the third calendar month
following the date on which the Participant would have attained age 55. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE VI </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Form and Time of Payment </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.1 <U>Time
of Payment</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit shall be paid beginning on the later of (i)&nbsp;the first business day of the month
following the Participant&#146;s attainment of age 55, or (ii)&nbsp;six months after the Participant Separates from Service (the &#147;Payment Date&#148;). In no event shall payment commence later than the fifteenth day of the third calendar month
following the Payment Date. If payment is made under subsection (ii), on the first business day of the seventh month following the Participant&#146;s termination from employment, the Participant shall receive a lump sum payment equal to the payments
that would have been paid during the six-month suspension period described in the preceding sentence. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">6.2 <U>Form of Payment</U>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A Participant shall elect to have the Plan Benefit paid in one of the forms of payment described in this Section&nbsp;6.2 of the Plan. A
Participant who has not commenced payment by December&nbsp;31, 2008, shall elect a payment form no later than December&nbsp;31, 2008. An Eligible Employee who is not a Participant in the Plan on December&nbsp;31, 2008, shall make an election as to
form of payment within 30 days of becoming a Participant in the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-10- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Modified Spouse Option</U>. An adjusted Plan Benefit payable for the Participant&#146;s life with the provision that after the Participant&#146;s death a percentage of the Plan
Benefit (10% to 100% in 10% increments, or 75%) shall be continued during the life of the Participant&#146;s spouse (at the time of retirement) if the beneficiary survives the Participant. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Contingent Annuitant Option</U>. An adjusted Plan Benefit payable for the Participant&#146;s life, with the provision that after death a percentage of the Plan Benefit (10% to
100% in 10% increments, or 75%) shall be continued during the life of the Participant&#146;s beneficiary (at the time of retirement), if the beneficiary survives the Participant. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Ten-Year Certain and Life Option</U>. An adjusted Plan Benefit payable for the Participant&#146;s life with the provision that in the event of the Participant&#146;s death within
the shorter of ten years of the Participant&#146;s life expectancy determined at the Participant&#146;s annuity starting date, payment shall be continued for the duration of such ten-year or life expectancy period to the beneficiary designated by
the Participant. If such beneficiary does not survive such period, the commuted value equal to the Actuarial Equivalent of any payments remaining shall be paid to the legal representatives of the last to survive of the Participant and the
beneficiary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Ten-Year Certain and Contingent Annuitant Option</U>. An adjusted Plan Benefit payable for the Participant&#146;s life with the provision that in the event of the
Participant&#146;s death within the shorter of ten years or the Participant&#146;s life expectancy determined at the annuity starting date payment shall be continued for the duration of such ten-year or life expectancy period to the beneficiary
designated by the Participant. At the end of the ten-year or life expectancy period, a percentage of the Plan Benefit without adjustment for the ten-year certain feature (10% to 90% in 10% increments) shall be continued during the life of the
Participant&#146;s beneficiary (at the time of retirement), if the beneficiary survives the Participant. If the beneficiary does not survive the initial ten-year period, the commuted value equal to the Actuarial Equivalent of any payments remaining
shall be paid to the legal representatives of the last to survive of the Participant and the beneficiary. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><U>Single Life Annuity</U>. A annuity payable for the Participant&#146;s life. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Prior to commencement of payment of a Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit, the Participant may elect a </FONT>
</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-11- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">different form of annuity, provided that the payments forms are actuarially equivalent. Such a change in annuity shall not be considered a change in the time
and form of a payment under Section&nbsp;409A of the Code. In the event that a Participant does not make an election as to form of payment, the Plan Benefit shall be paid in the form of a single life annuity if the Participant is not married on the
benefit commencement date, and a joint and 50% survivor annuity (with the Participant&#146;s spouse as the contingent annuitant) if the Participant is married on the benefit commencement date. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE VII </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Administration </B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.1 <U>Pension Administration Committee</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee shall supervise the daily management and administration of the Plan. The members of the Pension Administration Committee shall serve without compensation. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.2 <U>Responsibilities and Powers of the Pension Administration Committee and Compensation Committee</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee shall have the responsibility: </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To administer the Plan in accordance with the terms hereof, and to exercise all powers specifically conferred upon the Pension Administration Committee hereby or necessary to carry
out the provisions thereof; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="5%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">To keep all records relating to Participants of the Plan and such other records as are necessary for proper operation of the Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Compensation Committee shall be responsible for construing this Plan, which construction shall be conclusive, correcting any defects, supplying omissions, and reconciling
inconsistencies to the extent necessary to effectuate the Plan. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.3 <U>Operation of the Pension Administration Committee</U>
</FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In carrying out the Pension Administration Committee&#146;s functions hereunder: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee may adopt rules and regulations necessary for the administration of the Plan and which are consistent with the provisions hereof.
</FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All acts and decisions of the Pension Administration Committee shall be approved by a majority of the members of the Pension Administration Committee and shall apply uniformly to
all Participants in like circumstances. Written records shall be kept of all acts and decisions. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-12- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee may authorize one or more of its members to act on its behalf. The Pension Administration Committee may also delegate, in writing, any of its
responsibilities and powers to an individual(s) who is not a Pension Administration Committee member. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee shall have the right to hire, at the expense of an Employer, such professional assistants and consultants as it, in its sole discretion, deems
necessary or advisable, including, but not limited to, accountants, actuaries, consultants, counsel and such clerical assistance as is necessary for proper discharge of its duties. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">7.4 <U>Indemnification</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">In addition to
any other indemnification that a fiduciary, including but not limited to a member of the Pension Administration Committee, the Compensation Committee or the Executive Committee, is entitled to, an Employer shall indemnify such fiduciary from all
claims for liability, loss or damage (including payment of expenses in connection with defense against such claim) arising from any act or failure to act which constitutes a breach of such individual&#146;s fiduciary responsibilities with respect to
this Plan under any aspects of the law. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:24px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>ARTICLE VIII </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Miscellaneous </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.1 <U>Benefits Payable by an Employer</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">All benefits payable under this Plan constitute an unfunded obligation of an Employer. Payments shall be made, as due, from the general funds of an
Employer. An Employer, at its option, may maintain one or more bookkeeping reserve accounts to reflect its obligations under the Plan and may make such investments as it may deem desirable to assist it in meeting with obligations. Nothing contained
in this Section&nbsp;8.1 of the Plan shall limit the ability of an Employer to pay benefits hereunder through a Rabbi Trust. Any such investments shall be assets of an Employer subject to claims of its general creditors. No person eligible for a
benefit under this Plan shall have any right, title to interest in any such investments. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.2 <U>Amendment or Termination</U> </FONT></P>
<P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Board of Directors reserves the right to amend, modify, or restate or terminate the Plan in accordance with this Section&nbsp;8.2 of the Plan. No such action by
the Board of Directors shall reduce a Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit accrued as of the time thereof. The provisions of this Section&nbsp;8.2 of the Plan prohibiting an action by the Board of Directors which would reduce a Participant&#146;s accrued
Plan Benefit cannot be amended without the consent of all Participants (including those who have retired). Any amendment to the Plan shall be made in writing by the Board of Directors, with or without a meeting, or shall be made in writing by the
Pension Administration </FONT>
</P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-13- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="8%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"> <P>
<FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Committee, the Compensation Committee, or the Executive Committee, to the extent that Board of Directors has specifically delegated the authority to make
such amendment to the Plan the Pension Administration Committee, the Compensation Committee or the Executive Committee. </FONT></P></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Plan is terminated, a determination shall be made of each Participant&#146;s Plan Benefit as of the Plan termination date (determined in accordance with Section&nbsp;8.2(a)
of the Plan). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">No amendment or termination made within one year before a Change in Control and made while a Prospective Change in Control is pending may adversely affect any benefit that might at
any time be or become owing hereunder to a person who, immediately prior to the commencement of such Prospective Change in Control, was an Officer who is an Eligible Employee without the consent of such person (other than a benefit to any such
person who is the person, or part of the group, making the offer, or negotiating to make the offer, which constitutes the Prospective Change in Control). As used herein, the term &#147;Prospective Change in Control&#148; means (i)&nbsp;any offer
presented, directly or indirectly, to the Board of Directors of the Company which, if consummated, would constitute a Change in Control or (ii)&nbsp;any negotiation with the Board of Directors or any committee or representative thereof to make such
an offer (including the unilateral announcement of the terms on which such an offer would be made). </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.3 <U>Status of
Employment</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Nothing herein contained shall be construed as conferring any rights upon any Participant or any person for a continuation
of employment, nor shall it be construed as limiting in any way the right of an Employer to discharge any Participant or to treat the Participant without regard to the effect which such treatment might have upon the Participant. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.4 <U>Payments to Minors and Incompetents</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman"
SIZE="2">If a Participant or beneficiary entitled to receive any benefits hereunder is a minor or is deemed by the Pension Administration Committee or is adjudged to be legally incapable of giving valid receipt and discharge for such benefits, they
will be paid to the duly appointed guardian of such minor or incompetent or to such other legally appointed person as the Pension Administration Committee might designate. Such payment shall, to the extent made, be deemed a complete discharge of any
liability for such payment under the Plan. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.5 <U>Authorized Payments</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Pension Administration Committee may at any time and from time to time require, as a condition precedent to making or authorizing the payment of any
benefit hereunder, evidence of the prospective payee&#146;s right to receive such payment. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing, the Pension Administration Committee may require evidence of the date of birth of any Participant,
contingent annuitant or beneficiary, or of survival of a contingent annuitant or beneficiary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-14- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.6 <U>Inalienability of Benefits</U> </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The right of any person to any benefit or payment under the Plan shall not be subject to voluntary or involuntary transfer, alienation or assignment, and,
to the fullest extent permitted by law, shall not be subject to attachment, execution, garnishment, sequestration or other legal or equitable process. In the event a person who is receiving or is entitled to receive benefits under the Plan attempts
to assign, transfer or dispose of such right, or if an attempt is made to subject said right to such process, such assignment, transfer or disposition shall be null and void. </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.7 <U>Adjustment of Benefits</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the
date of birth or other data deemed by the Pension Administration Committee to be vital, with respect to any Participant, contingent annuitant or beneficiary shall be misstated, the Pension Administration Committee may limit the amount and date of
payment of benefits to any such person, the Participant&#146;s contingent annuitant and/or other beneficiary (whether or not such person shall have theretofore retired in accordance with the Plan) to the reduced benefits which would be payable in
accordance with the correct information. In such case, payments of benefits made subsequent to the date of discovery of any such misstatement shall be adjusted for any excess or deficiency (based upon the correct facts) in the amount of benefits
theretofore paid to such person, the Participant&#146;s contingent annuitant and/or other beneficiary. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.8 <U>Claim and Appeal
Procedure</U>. This Section&nbsp;8.8 of the Plan shall not apply with respect to benefits payable after a Change in Control. The Company shall appoint a person or persons to adjudicate claims and appeals under the Plan (the
&#147;Administrator&#148;). The Administrator shall provide adequate notice in writing to any Participant or to any beneficiary (the &#147;Claimant&#148;) whose claim for benefits under the Plan has been denied. The Administrator&#146;s notice to
the Claimant shall set forth: </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(a)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The specific reason for the denial; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(b)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Specific references to pertinent Plan provisions upon which the Administrator based its denial; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(c)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A description of any additional material and information that is needed; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(d)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">That any appeal the Claimant wishes to make of the adverse determination must be in writing to the Administrator within seventy-five (75)&nbsp;days after receipt of the
Administrator&#146;s notice of denial of benefits. The Administrator&#146;s notice must further advise the Claimant that the Claimant&#146;s failure to appeal the action to the Administrator in writing within the seventy-five (75)&nbsp;day period
will render the Administrator&#146;s determination final, binding and conclusive; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(e)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The name and address to whom the Claimant may forward an appeal. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-15- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If the Claimant should appeal to the Administrator, the Claimant, or the Claimant&#146;s duly authorized
representative, may submit, in writing, whatever issues and comments the Claimant or the Claimant&#146;s duly authorized representative feels are pertinent. The Claimant, or the Claimant&#146;s duly authorized representative, may review pertinent
Plan documents. The Administrator shall re-examine all facts to the appeal and make a final determination as to whether the denial of benefits is justified under the circumstances. The Administrator shall advise the Claimant of its decision within
sixty (60)&nbsp;days of the Claimant&#146;s written request for review, unless special circumstances (such as a hearing) would make the rendering of a decision within the sixty (60)&nbsp;day limit unfeasible, but in no event shall the Administrator
render a decision respecting a denial for a claim of benefits later than one hundred twenty (120)&nbsp;days after its receipt of a request for review. The Administrator&#146;s notice to the Claimant shall set forth: </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(i)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The specific reason for the denial; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(ii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Specific references to pertinent Plan provisions upon which the Administrator based its denial; </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P
STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iii)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A statement that the Claimant is entitled to receive, upon request and free of charge, reasonable access to, and copies of, all documents, records, and other information relevant to
the Claimant&#146;s claim; and </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%"><FONT SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">(iv)</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">A statement that the Claimant has a right to bring a civil action under Section&nbsp;502(a) of ERISA. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px"><FONT
SIZE="1">&nbsp;</FONT></P>
 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">-16- </FONT></P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" COLOR="#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">8.9 <U>Governing Law</U> </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:6px;margin-bottom:0px; text-indent:4%"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">Except to the extent pre-empted by federal law, the provisions of the Plan will be construed according to the laws of the State of New Jersey. </FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px"
ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;* </FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>

<DESCRIPTION>CYTEC COMPENSATION TAXATION EQUALIZATION PLAN
<TEXT>
<HTML><HEAD>
<TITLE>Cytec Compensation Taxation Equalization Plan</TITLE>
</HEAD>
 <BODY BGCOLOR="WHITE">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="right"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>Exhibit 10.2(l) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT
FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>CYTEC INDUSTRIES INC. </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B><U>COMPENSATION TAXATION EQUALIZATION PLAN </U></B></FONT></P> <P
STYLE="margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2"><B>(as restated effective January&nbsp;1, 2009) </B></FONT></P> <P STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">1.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If an Excess Tax is imposed on any person who is, or was at the time, an employee, officer or director of Cytec Industries Inc., a Delaware corporation (the &#147;Corporation&#148;)
or of any subsidiary of the Corporation, then the Corporation (or such subsidiary), shall pay as additional compensation to such person a Tax Equalization Amount on the first day of the seventh month following such person&#146;s Separation from
Service. However, in no event shall the payment be made, or commence, later than the fifteenth day of the third calendar month following the date on which such person has been Separated from Service for six months. Separation from Service occurs on
the date that such person dies, retires, or otherwise has a termination of employment with the Corporation (within the meaning of Treasury Regulation Section&nbsp;1.409A-1). For purposes of this Plan, (a)&nbsp;&#147;Excess Tax&#148; shall mean the
tax which is imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, or by any corresponding provision of any subsequent Internal Revenue Code, as the same may be amended from time to time, by reason of any payment or benefit which such
person has received from, or under any plan of, the Corporation (or subsidiary of the Corporation); and (b)&nbsp;the &#147;Tax Equalization Amount&#148; shall be an amount which, after taking into account all taxes (including any Excess Tax) imposed
upon such amount by any federal, state or local government, is equal to the amount of the tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">2.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">If any payment to which paragraph 1 of this Plan applies is subject to withholding, then the additional payment in respect of the withholding shall be made at the time of the
withholding. If the tax is imposed other than by, or in addition to, withholding, then the additional payment shall be made at the time the tax is payable and for such purpose the person shall make available to the Corporation such information as
the Corporation may require in order to determine the amount of tax which will be imposed. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">3.</FONT></TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">The Corporation reserves the right to amend or terminate this Plan at any time, provided, that no such amendment or termination shall adversely affect the right of any person to
receive any amount under this Plan who becomes subject to the tax imposed by Section&nbsp;4999 in whole or in part by reason of any change in the ownership or effective control of the Corporation occurring prior to the date of such amendment or
termination. </FONT></TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="margin-top:12px;margin-bottom:0px" ALIGN="center"><FONT FACE="Times New Roman" SIZE="2">*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;*&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;* </FONT></P> <P
STYLE="font-size:12px;margin-top:0px;margin-bottom:0px">&nbsp;</P>
